item.title: Inject psql prompt
item.description: I’ve been working with databases quite a bit recently. Usually these databases are temporary forks used for testing, and they only have an ip address. It gets hard to keep track of which ip is which, and I’m always worried running the wrong command on an actual production database. So I came up with this shell function db, used like db $ZACH_DB_URL. When run this connects psql to that database, and give me a prompt like ZACH@127.
